result.execSummary:
The defendant Brian K Hazard was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: all other sentence with credit for 0 days time served.

miscConds.notes: Pay all applicable costs and surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, the domestic violence surcharge, DNA surcharge, and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections, during period of probation or civil judgment.
Obtain and maintain employment. Minimum of 25 hours per week. Job training, school, work or community service.

No firearms; weapons.
48USC Section 922(g)(9) prohibits possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence.
No contact with victim, DIane P. without prior court approval. Defendant may have contact with the victim through a third party to arrange time with children.

Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" counseling and continue programming.
Mental Health Evaluation and take all prescribed medications.
Attend and complete parenting classes.
Random urine screens and breathalyzer test.
Maintain absolute sobriety. No drugs. No alcohol.
Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
Restitution is set at zero.
Defendant may not have any pets.
Participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.

timeConds.notes: Stayed pending review. Agent to request date for probation review hearing.

Defendant Brian K Hazard in court with attorney Enku E Lin.  Defendant Brian K. Hazard in custody.  Kristin M Schrank appeared for Nicolas Heitman for the State of Wisconsin. 
 Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered COUNT #2 and COUNT #3, dismissed and read-in for the purposes of sentencing.

 AS TO COUNT #1:   Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint. Judgment of conviction entered.   Courts finds that State has complied with victim notification.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Additional statements by: Diane P and Michael Olszak. 
 Defendant sentenced to serve 6 MONTHS (CONSECUTIVE to all other sentences), in the House of Correction with credit for 0 days time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 3 YEARS.  MONTHS/YEARS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
* Court ordered the defendant to serve 60 DAYS
   in the House of Correction.  Stayed pending review.
* Successfully complete "Batterers intervention"
   counseling and continue programming.
* Mental Health Evaluation and take all prescribed medications.
* Attend and complete parenting classes.
* Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment
   and successfully complete recommended treatment.
* Random urine screens and breathalyzer test.
* Maintain absolute sobriety.  No drugs.  No alcohol.
* Successfully complete any other counseling and/or
   treatment deemed appropriate.
* No contact with victim, Diane P. 
   without prior court approval.  
* Defendant may have contact with the victim
   through a third party to arrange time with children.
* Obtain and maintain employment.  
   Minimun of 25 hours per week.
   Job training, school, work or community service. 
* No firearms; weapons.
* Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges,
   victim/witness surcharge, the domestic violence
   surcharge, DNA surcharge, and supervision fees as 
   determined by the Department of Corrections, 
   during period of probation or CIVIL JUDGMENT.   
   --- Costs also apply to case 2013CF5610).
* Restitution is set at zero.
* Defendant may not have any pets.
**AGENT TO REQUEST DATE FOR PROBATION REVIEW HEARING.
48USC Section 922(g)(9) prohibits possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence.
 Filed,
Memorandum of Conditions of Probation. 
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.   mld

Attorney Enku Edgar Lin in court (via telephonics), defendant Brian K Hazard not in court, in custody.  Nicolas Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
 Off the record.  Due to the unavailability of the court, Plea and Sentencing Hearing rescheduled to branch 4 on 4-24-2014 at 1:30 pm.   mld

Defendant Brian K Hazard in court with attorney Enku Edgar Lin.  Defendant Brian K Hazard in custody.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
 Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Defendant acknowledged receipt of discovery including an offer letter to resolve all (4) four cases.  Case adjourned for Plea and Sentencing Hearing in Branch 4 on 3-31-2014 at 1:30 pm.  

Statement made by Diane P., to request modification of the no contact order.  Court maintains the current no contact order.  mld

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring.  Drug testing, absolute sobriety, no possession or use of controlled substance without a valid prescription.  Absolutely no release from home (24 hour curfew).   mld

Attorney Enku Edgar Lin in court, defendant Brian K Hazard not in court, in custody.  Enku Edgar Lin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  The Court increased bail to $2,500.00 with gps supervision on cases 2013CF44211, 2013CF5610 and 2014CF155.  Court maintains the cash bail on 2014CF669 with the addition of gps supervision.  Case adjourned for Preliminary Hearing in Branch 4 on 3-3-2014 at 1:30 pm.   mld
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Diane P.

Defendant Brian K Hazard in court with attorney Anne A Devitt.  Defendant Brian K Hazard in custody.  Maureen A. Atwell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Flanagan, Branch 04. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 3, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
